A: Provide the ability to automatically establish recurring payments with an end date and frequency (user defined), extension  capability, and the ability to modify chart of accounts coding.

A: Provide the ability to automatically establish recurring payments with an end date and frequency (user defined), extension  capability, and the ability to modify chart of accounts coding.
B: Provide automatic inclusion of credits and penalties within invoices for late delivery, untimely warranty service, and other  predefined violations of contract terms and conditions.

A: Provide the ability to automatically establish recurring payments with an end date and frequency (user defined), extension  capability, and the ability to modify chart of accounts coding.
B: Override invoices rejected for services performed past contract end date to allow payment with penalty for late services.

A: Provide the ability to automatically establish recurring payments with an end date and frequency (user defined), extension  capability, and the ability to modify chart of accounts coding.
B: Provide the ability to consolidate payments across agencies.

A: Provide the ability to automatically establish recurring payments with an end date and frequency (user defined), extension  capability, and the ability to modify chart of accounts coding.
B: Allow users the option to not consolidate payments by type of payment method (i.e. consolidate checks but not EFT).

A: Provide the ability to automatically establish recurring payments with an end date and frequency (user defined), extension  capability, and the ability to modify chart of accounts coding.

A: Provide the ability to automatically establish recurring payments with an end date and frequency (user defined), extension  capability, and the ability to modify chart of accounts coding.

A: Provide standard payment terms at the vendor level or individual payment terms at the payment level.
B: Prevent duplicate payment voucher numbers.

A: Provide standard payment terms at the vendor level or individual payment terms at the payment level.
B: Allow users to drill down to all purchase order information on-line during payment voucher processing.

A: Provide standard payment terms at the vendor level or individual payment terms at the payment level.
B: Provide the ability to control payments in excess of encumbered amounts by user-defined tolerance limits for each type of  encumbrance (e.g., 10% or $50 over encumbrance amount) provided sufficient spending authority exists.

A: Provide standard payment terms at the vendor level or individual payment terms at the payment level.
B: Automatically calculate invoice due date based on invoice date or a user-specified date (such as 30 days from the date of  receipt) and payment terms and schedules optimum payment date based on that calculation.

A: Provide standard payment terms at the vendor level or individual payment terms at the payment level.
B: Provide ability to flag invoices for additional workflow approval upon entry.

A: Provide standard payment terms at the vendor level or individual payment terms at the payment level.
B: Provide the ability to indicate whether payment is final or partial upon entry of the invoice.

A: Provide standard payment terms at the vendor level or individual payment terms at the payment level.
B: Allow for the input of invoice receipt date.

A: Provide standard payment terms at the vendor level or individual payment terms at the payment level.
B: Automatically generate payments based on three way matching (invoice, receipt, PO).

A: Provide standard payment terms at the vendor level or individual payment terms at the payment level.
B: Provide the ability to associate a payment with matching purchase documentation and receiving information.

A: Provide standard payment terms at the vendor level or individual payment terms at the payment level.
B: Highlight discrepancies between purchase order, invoice and receiving document: Unit price variances.

A: Provide standard payment terms at the vendor level or individual payment terms at the payment level.
B: Highlight discrepancies between purchase order, invoice and receiving document: Quantity received vs. quantity ordered vs.  quantity invoiced.

A: Provide standard payment terms at the vendor level or individual payment terms at the payment level.
B: Highlight discrepancies between purchase order, invoice and receiving document: Extended value of the PO vs. extended value  of the invoice.

A: Provide standard payment terms at the vendor level or individual payment terms at the payment level.
B: Highlight discrepancies between encumbrance, invoice and authorizing documents for non-commodity purchases: Hourly rate for  services (i.e., consulting, contracted personnel services, etc.).

A: Provide standard payment terms at the vendor level or individual payment terms at the payment level.
B: Highlight discrepancies between encumbrance, invoice and authorizing documents for non-commodity purchases: Deliverables.

A: Provide standard payment terms at the vendor level or individual payment terms at the payment level.
B: Highlight discrepancies between encumbrance, invoice and authorizing documents for non-commodity purchases: Terms of  contract.

A: Provide standard payment terms at the vendor level or individual payment terms at the payment level.
B: Provide for user-defined tolerances in price and quantity, both on the individual line level and a cumulative tolerance on the  header level. As long as the match is within tolerance, payment voucher transaction will be accepted.

A: Provide standard payment terms at the vendor level or individual payment terms at the payment level.
B: Require the user to enter additional information for assets valued at a system configured dollar value.

A: Provide standard payment terms at the vendor level or individual payment terms at the payment level.
B: Allow input of freight invoices/payments where there may be no corresponding purchase order reference.

A: Provide standard payment terms at the vendor level or individual payment terms at the payment level.
B: Provide a report for freight invoice/payment additions with no corresponding purchase order reference.

A: Provide standard payment terms at the vendor level or individual payment terms at the payment level.
B: Prevent freight charges on invoices that have FOB destination terms.

A: Provide standard payment terms at the vendor level or individual payment terms at the payment level.
B: Automatically default certain line item details for PO related payments during vendor invoice entry with override capability.

A: Provide standard payment terms at the vendor level or individual payment terms at the payment level.
B: Provide link to document management stored documents.

A: Provide standard payment terms at the vendor level or individual payment terms at the payment level.
B: Prevent un-authorized users from generating payments to vendors that are not in the vendor table.

A: Provide standard payment terms at the vendor level or individual payment terms at the payment level.

A: Provide standard payment terms at the vendor level or individual payment terms at the payment level.

A: Provide standard payment terms at the vendor level or individual payment terms at the payment level.

A: Provide standard payment terms at the vendor level or individual payment terms at the payment level.

A: Generate accrual transactions for goods and services received and not invoiced by period end (month end and year-end).

A: Automatically calculate invoice due date based on invoice date or a user-specified date (such as 30 days from the date of  receipt) and payment terms and schedules optimum payment date based on that calculation.

A: Automatically calculate invoice due date based on invoice date or a user-specified date (such as 30 days from the date of  receipt) and payment terms and schedules optimum payment date based on that calculation.

A: Provide the ability to void or correct payments on-line, with appropriate corrections made to all financial balances.

A: Process invoices and payment from prior periods and properly update general ledger with proper authority.
B: Provide ability to perform annual encumbrance and commitments reviews and close-outs at year end.

A: Process invoices and payment from prior periods and properly update general ledger with proper authority.
B: Provide for assignment of unique pre-encumbrance and encumbrance document numbers, which are system-generated or  manually entered.

A: Process invoices and payment from prior periods and properly update general ledger with proper authority.
B: Accommodate the recording of: Pre-encumbered encumbrances.

A: Process invoices and payment from prior periods and properly update general ledger with proper authority.
B: Accommodate the recording of: Non pre-encumbered encumbrances.

A: Process invoices and payment from prior periods and properly update general ledger with proper authority.
B: Accommodate the recording of: Non-pre-encumbered/non-encumbered vendor invoices, with the appropriate security control.

A: Process invoices and payment from prior periods and properly update general ledger with proper authority.
B: Provide the ability to enter an invoice number with a minimum of 60 alphanumeric characters available.

A: Process invoices and payment from prior periods and properly update general ledger with proper authority.
B: Reject transactions for insufficient budget (users with the appropriate level of security having override ability).

A: Process invoices and payment from prior periods and properly update general ledger with proper authority.
B: Determine whether to reject disbursements if insufficient budget balance or allow payment despite lack of sufficient funds.

A: Process invoices and payment from prior periods and properly update general ledger with proper authority.
B: Provide the ability to flag an appropriation account so that no payments can be disbursed.

A: Process invoices and payment from prior periods and properly update general ledger with proper authority.
B: For partial payments that the user indicates is a final payment, provide the automatic liquidation of outstanding encumbrance  balances for the invoice amount up to the outstanding encumbrance balance up to a threshold amount.

A: Process invoices and payment from prior periods and properly update general ledger with proper authority.
B: Prevent duplicate payments by editing invoice numbers, Tax Id, and dollar amounts.

A: Process invoices and payment from prior periods and properly update general ledger with proper authority.
B: Prevent duplicate payments by editing invoice numbers (exclusive of leading zeros) and dollar amounts.

A: Process invoices and payment from prior periods and properly update general ledger with proper authority.
B: Provide the ability to override edits errors on duplicate payments based upon invoice or amounts to allow payments by  individuals with the appropriate security.

A: Process invoices and payment from prior periods and properly update general ledger with proper authority.
B: Provide an indicator that determines if the duplicate invoice edit produces fatal (prevents posting) error or warning message.

A: Process invoices and payment from prior periods and properly update general ledger with proper authority.
B: Provide the ability to automatically establish recurring payments with an end date and frequency (user defined), extension  capability, and the ability to modify chart of accounts coding.

A: Process invoices and payment from prior periods and properly update general ledger with proper authority.
B: Establish recurring payments with an end date when leases are recorded.

A: Process invoices and payment from prior periods and properly update general ledger with proper authority.
B: Establish lease liabilities by fiscal year or accounting period.

A: Process invoices and payment from prior periods and properly update general ledger with proper authority.
B: Process prepaid expenses (i.e., advanced payment, travel, etc.).

A: Process invoices and payment from prior periods and properly update general ledger with proper authority.
B: Provide standard payment terms at the vendor level or individual payment terms at the payment level.

A: Process invoices and payment from prior periods and properly update general ledger with proper authority.
B: Generate accrual transactions for goods and services received and not invoiced by period end (month end and year-end).

A: Process invoices and payment from prior periods and properly update general ledger with proper authority.
B: Establish liability when goods are received. Functionality will include relieving the liability when paid, even if a discount is taken.

A: Process invoices and payment from prior periods and properly update general ledger with proper authority.
B: Support the ability to electronically notify vendors of payment data availability through vendor self service.

A: Process invoices and payment from prior periods and properly update general ledger with proper authority.
B: Provide a flag on the vendor master that indicates the W-9 information is current.

A: Process invoices and payment from prior periods and properly update general ledger with proper authority.
B: Support the ability for a vendor to update W-9 and direct deposit information via self service using Web access.

A: Process invoices and payment from prior periods and properly update general ledger with proper authority.
B: Allow for payment method options as an override by invoice with proper authority. Example, a county may be required to have a  check payment for a specific invoice, but could have an ACH payment for another. The application should allow for a variety of  payment options based upon invoice not exclusively by payee. .

A: Process invoices and payment from prior periods and properly update general ledger with proper authority.
B: Support CCD and CTX transactions to allow greater payment detail to the payee and financial institution.

A: Process invoices and payment from prior periods and properly update general ledger with proper authority.
B: Provide standard interfaces for document imaging.

A: Process invoices and payment from prior periods and properly update general ledger with proper authority.
B: Provide the ability to change the due date so that invoices are paid with proper authority.

A: Process invoices and payment from prior periods and properly update general ledger with proper authority.
B: Provide the ability to put an invoice on hold so that it is not paid.

B: Provide the ability to reverse an unpaid payment invoice.

B: Allow users the ability to save, retrieve, and update invoice transactions by payee.

A: Process invoices and payment from prior periods and properly update general ledger with proper authority.

B: Highlight discrepancies between purchase order, invoice and receiving document: Unit price variances.
